title: How to Have a Disney Frozen Themed Room

steps.headline: Watch the movie Frozen (so you know what to do).
Start with a white and/or blue paint (for the icy look).
Start getting your Frozen stock of stuff (bedspreads, dolls, technology, etc).
Add on to your items with some winter and snowflake decor.
Draw Frozen characters to paste on your wall.
steps.description: You can also buy stickers and paste them on. If you want to, you can make Frozen Fever (sequel) inspired drawings, like the cake.

steps.headline: Remember, keep your room blue, white, frozen, and wintry.
If you want to be obsessed with Frozen, go to Walmart, Target, or Party City.
If you want to add other decor besides the theme, keep it a bit hidden.
Try blue or teal painted dressers for desks, and chairs.
steps.description: Make sure they all match. For the bed do a pink or blue blanket. You can also buy a blanket with Frozen characters on them. Toy boxes should have snowflakes (Frozen) or pink flowers (Frozen Fever) on them. Make sure the furniture is suitable for your wall.

steps.headline: Add cool colored rugs to your bedroom.
steps.description: This will give your bedroom a cozy and icy look at the same time. The cool colors that are recommended are blue, white and purple. Green is for more of a festive look.

steps.headline: Try a blue welcome sign on your door to let people think you are nice.
steps.description: Put icicles on it for an extra blast of an icy look. Don't put a welcome sign on if you don't mean it.

text: Watch the movie Frozen (so you know what to do).  Start with a white and/or blue paint (for the icy look).  Start getting your Frozen stock of stuff (bedspreads, dolls, technology, etc).  Add on to your items with some winter and snowflake decor.  Draw Frozen characters to paste on your wall. You can also buy stickers and paste them on. If you want to, you can make Frozen Fever (sequel) inspired drawings, like the cake. Remember, keep your room blue, white, frozen, and wintry.  If you want to be obsessed with Frozen, go to Walmart, Target, or Party City. They will have you covered. If you want to add other decor besides the theme, keep it a bit hidden.  Try blue or teal painted dressers for desks, and chairs. Make sure they all match. For the bed do a pink or blue blanket. You can also buy a blanket with Frozen characters on them. Toy boxes should have snowflakes (Frozen) or pink flowers (Frozen Fever) on them. Make sure the furniture is suitable for your wall. Add cool colored rugs to your bedroom. This will give your bedroom a cozy and icy look at the same time. The cool colors that are recommended are blue, white and purple. Green is for more of a festive look. Try a blue welcome sign on your door to let people think you are nice. Put icicles on it for an extra blast of an icy look. Don't put a welcome sign on if you don't mean it.
